p: Human saliva is a unique body fluid secreted by the salivary glands. It is mainly composed of water (94%–99%), with organic molecules accounting for approximately 0.5% and inorganic molecules for 0.2% (Zhang et al., 2016). It has the functions of lubricating oral mucosa, digesting food, cleaning and protecting the oral cavity, and is one of the most important factors affecting homeostasis of the oral cavity (Helmerhorst & Oppenheim, 2007). A normal adult secretes approximately 600 ml of saliva every day (Zhang et al., 2016). In addition to salivary gland excreta, saliva also contains food residue, serum components, oral microorganisms, and their metabolites, exfoliated epithelial cells and white blood cells (Proctor et al., 2018).
